moves.1. e4 e5 2. Nf3 Nc6 3. d4 Bb4+ 4. c3 exd: Probably should have moved the bishop out of danger.
moves.5. cxb4 Nxb4: Moving the knight left the pawn unprotected.
moves.6. Nxd4 Ne7: By moving the knight (Ne7), black's queen is blocked.
moves.7. Bc4: Moving the bishop opened the way to castle for white.
moves.7... Ned5: d5 is protected by a pawn and a bishop. White will gladly trade a pawn for a knight.
moves.8. exd5 d6 9. O-O Qf6 10. Qe1+: Qe1 forks the king and the knight, gobbling the knight.
moves.10... Kd7 11. Qxb4 Qxd4: It was a trade, but since white is ahead, trades are to his advantage.
moves.12. Nc3 Qg4 13. Bd2 Qh3: Ooops. Forgot about the pawn. Gave the queen away.
moves.14. gxh3 Re8: The rest of the game is pretty sure for white.
